greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where the n-th row lists the (2n+1) coefficients of (1+2x+3x^2)^n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..100, flattened
maple: f:= proc(n) option remember; expand((1+2*x+3*x^2)^n) end:
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..2*n), n=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 03 2011
mathematica: row[n_] := (1+2x+3x^2)^n + O[x]^(2n+1) // CoefficientList[#, x]&; Table[row[n], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 01 2017 *)
program: (p:ps) * qs'@(q:qs) = p * q : ps * qs' + [p] * qs
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 01 2003
